chapters.title: The Hidden Dangers of Unguided AI Development

content.introduction: In recent years, we've witnessed the emergence of what some call 'vibe coding' – using AI tools like Cursor, GitHub Copilot, or ChatGPT to write code with minimal programming knowledge.

sections.title: The Rise of 'Vibe Coding' and Its Pitfalls
content: As one developer noted, 'This wave of vibe coding isn't inherently bad. It can spark interest in programming for people who wouldn't otherwise try it. It's like how HTML and CSS widgets fascinated many of us years ago and led us into web development.'
However, there's a critical distinction between using AI to assist your coding and relying on it to build production software without understanding the underlying principles.
When your project becomes complex, AI models go from writing good code to merely working code to eventually bad code that's neither functional nor maintainable.

sections.title: The 3 AM Nightmare
content: It's 3 AM. Alex stares at the screen, eyes burning from exhaustion. The project deadline is in six hours, but something has gone terribly wrong.
'I was just trying to use Cursor to help with a simple database query,' Alex whispers to the empty room.
The reality? AI coding tools are powerful, but without proper guardrails, they can become digital wrecking balls in your codebase.

sections.title: The Unseen Crisis in AI-Assisted Development
content: If you picked up this book, you might be:
• A developer excited about AI coding assistants but wary of their risks
• Someone who's already experienced the chaos of uncontrolled AI changes
• A team lead trying to establish safe AI practices
• A professional looking to harness AI's power without its pitfalls

sections.title: When AI Goes Rogue: The Real Costs
content: The allure of AI coding tools is undeniable:
• Fix complex bugs with simple prompts
But without proper controls, these benefits quickly become liabilities.

quotes.text: AI is an amazing copilot, but a dangerous pilot.
quotes.author: Jamie, Backend Developer

quotes.text: You cannot be a 'vibe' production developer. The only viable approach is to build 'vibe personal software' while you're learning the fundamentals.
